title: An Ensemble Semi-Supervised Adaptive Resonance Theory Model with Explanation Capability for Pattern Classification. (arXiv:2305.14373v1 [cs.NE])
abstract: Most semi-supervised learning (SSL) models entail complex structures and iterative training processes as well as face difficulties in interpreting their predictions to users. To address these issues, this paper proposes a new interpretable SSL model using the supervised and unsupervised Adaptive Resonance Theory (ART) family of networks, which is denoted as SSL-ART. Firstly, SSL-ART adopts an unsupervised fuzzy ART network to create a number of prototype nodes using unlabeled samples. Then, it leverages a supervised fuzzy ARTMAP structure to map the established prototype nodes to the target classes using labeled samples. translated_title: 一种具有解释能力的集成半监督自适应共振理论模型用于模式分类
translated_abstract: 大多数半监督学习（SSL）模型需要复杂的结构和迭代训练过程，以及面临解释其预测结果给用户的困难。为了解决这些问题，本文提出了一种新的可解释的SSL模型，使用监督和非监督Adaptive Resonance Theory（ART）网络系列，称为SSL-ART。首先，SSL-ART采用非监督模糊ART网络来创建一些原型节点，使用未标记的样本。然后，它利用监督模糊ARTMAP结构，使用标记的样本将已建立的原型节点映射到目标类。具体来说，设计了一种一对多的映射方案，将原型节点与一个以上的类标签关联。SSL-ART的主要优点包括：（i）执行在线学习，（ii）通过OtM映射方案减少冗余原型节点并最小化噪声样本的影响，（iii）提供解释能力
tldr: 这篇论文提出了一种新的可以解释模型预测结果的集成半监督自适应共振理论模型（SSL-ART），其采用了非监督模糊ART网络和监督模糊ARTMAP结构实现对未标记样本和标记样本的学习和映射，并设计了一种一对多的映射方案减少冗余原型节点并最小化噪声样本的影响。
en_tdlr: This paper proposes a new interpretable SSL model, named SSL-ART, which uses the supervised and unsupervised Adaptive Resonance Theory networks to perform semi-supervised learning with explanation capability. It adopts a one-to-many mapping scheme to reduce redundant prototype nodes and minimize the effects of noisy samples, achieving satisfactory performance on pattern classification tasks.
